aspace_helpers.title: Add Aspace Environment Variables into ansible

comments.body:
Thanks @sandbergja ! You're right, the aspace url probably doesn't need to be vaulted.

I think we should set both urls on staging, but only ASPACE_URL on production, do you think that makes sense?

I haven't thought of the test.rb script as static. I use it to try things out all the time, and have assumed that others change it around as they need as well. Does that answer the question? Should we have a test_connection.rb?

aspace_helpers.title: construct MARC record from C0140 ASpace component

comments.body: That instance is strange/unusual because a few items were already digitized and in Figgy, and linked to the finding aid. I may have manually labeled that folder, to get around the issue? I don't think it's an important scenario to consider for the script.

I don't think it's anything you did! I think it's because of the item-level description. There are three components all referencing the same folder. In those situations, the script assumes 1) you want one folder label and 2) you still want to know all the component unittitles stored in that folder and 3) you want to know that this is one folder housing multiple components' worth of material. So it prints "Multiple Items" followed by the unittitles.

aspace_helpers.title: Generating MARC records from C0140 EAD component records/archival objects in Resource records

comments.body:
@kellybolding @LynnDurgin @faithc 

The records are updated in the Alma Sandbox. You can see them by going to Admin --> Manage Sets --> C0140_QA [don't open the link--select "Results" from the `...` menu]

@regineheberlein these are some things I noticed this morning:

- C0140_c13015-63029, C0140_c58698-80767: have a creator in 100 that is not in the ASpace record (it’s a creator for a different archival object)
- creator sometimes shows up in 700 rather than 100 (this seems to happen frequently, ex. C0140_c03405, C0140_c06899-84795, C0140_c15399-47122, C0140_c19588-90911)
- ampersands do not show up (which are sometimes part of formal business names, not sure it's a deal-breaker if it can't be resolved but thought it was worth mentioning): ex. C0140_c81225-20245 (& in DeHart & Letson shows up as DeHart Letson in 245 and 710 fields)
Thanks! I was just looking at the agents myself thanks to a note from DT, that's definitely a bug.
Interesting catch about the ampersand! I was ready to suspect Alma, but it happens on the export end. I'll see what if anything can be done about it.

orangelight.title: Use dynamic sitemaps rather than static ones

comments.body:
When I checked catalog2 today, there were no sitemap files at all in the public directory.

It looked like the previous run had failed after creating sitemap377.xml.gz with:

```
RSolr::Error::ConnectionRefused: Connection refused - {:params=>{:wt=>:json, "q"=>"*:*", "fl"=>"id", "cursorMark"=>"AoEsU0NTQi03MDM5NzYy", "rows"=>1000, "sort"=>"id asc"},
 :method=>:get, :query=>"wt=json&q=*%3A*&fl=id&cursorMark=AoEsU0NTQi03MDM5NzYy&rows=1000&sort=id+asc", :path=>"select", :uri=>#<URI::HTTP http://lib-solr8-prod.princeton.e
du:8983/solr/catalog-alma-production/select?wt=json&q=*%3A*&fl=id&cursorMark=AoEsU0NTQi03MDM5NzYy&rows=1000&sort=id+asc>}
/opt/orangelight/shared/bundle/ruby/2.7.0/gems/rsolr-2.5.0/lib/rsolr/client.rb:218:in `rescue in execute'
/opt/orangelight/shared/bundle/ruby/2.7.0/gems/rsolr-2.5.0/lib/rsolr/client.rb:208:in `execute'
/opt/orangelight/shared/bundle/ruby/2.7.0/gems/rsolr-2.5.0/lib/rsolr/client.rb:203:in `send_and_receive'
(eval):2:in `get'
/opt/orangelight/releases/20220801163717/config/sitemap.rb:16:in `block (2 levels) in run'
/opt/orangelight/releases/20220801163717/config/sitemap.rb:15:in `loop'
/opt/orangelight/releases/20220801163717/config/sitemap.rb:15:in `block in run'
/opt/orangelight/shared/bundle/ruby/2.7.0/gems/sitemap_generator-6.2.1/lib/sitemap_generator/interpreter.rb:61:in `instance_eval'
/opt/orangelight/shared/bundle/ruby/2.7.0/gems/sitemap_generator-6.2.1/lib/sitemap_generator/interpreter.rb:61:in `eval'
/opt/orangelight/shared/bundle/ruby/2.7.0/gems/sitemap_generator-6.2.1/lib/sitemap_generator/link_set.rb:40:in `create'
/opt/orangelight/shared/bundle/ruby/2.7.0/gems/sitemap_generator-6.2.1/lib/sitemap_generator.rb:42:in `method_missing'
/opt/orangelight/releases/20220801163717/config/sitemap.rb:6:in `run'
/opt/orangelight/shared/bundle/ruby/2.7.0/gems/sitemap_generator-6.2.1/lib/sitemap_generator/interpreter.rb:78:in `instance_eval'
/opt/orangelight/shared/bundle/ruby/2.7.0/gems/sitemap_generator-6.2.1/lib/sitemap_generator/interpreter.rb:78:in `run'
/opt/orangelight/shared/bundle/ruby/2.7.0/gems/sitemap_generator-6.2.1/lib/sitemap_generator/tasks.rb:51:in `block (2 levels) in <top (required)>'
/opt/orangelight/shared/bundle/ruby/2.7.0/gems/rake-12.3.3/exe/rake:27:in `<top (required)>'

Caused by:
Faraday::ConnectionFailed: end of file reached
```
Even when the files are generated correctly, the sitemap files are wiped out when orangelight is deployed.

Also a note that running this on prod takes something like 30 hours.  So it's definitely possible for some kind of minor solr connection blip to happen during that time, so we should also investigate making this more resilient against solr blips.
Closing this ticket in favor of #3166

Change Curator to Moderator

comments.body: @hhkitsune To clarify a Collection has a moderator and a DataSet has a Curator.  The dataset curator is the person who is curating that particular dataset currently.  The collection moderator(s) is a person who can add users to submit and add additional moderators in addition to assigning themselves as the curator for a data set.

- [ ] Improving the design and layout of the `Curated Files` on the Work View
- [ ] Ensuring that users can download the S3 resources
- [ ] Drafting an Architectural Design Record (ADR) documenting the team decision to store pre-curation uploads in ActiveStorage and post-curation uploads into Amazon S3 Buckets

pul_library_drupal.title: Update configuration for Specialist and Staff pages.
Remove Division, Section and Unit Display from Staff Profile Page

comments.body: PR closes this: https://github.com/pulibrary/pul_library_drupal/pull/1935.

It appears that the last remaining dependency on dependabot/64 is `gulp-sass-lint`, which is no longer being maintained. There is no one-to-one replacement that does not have the same vulnerable dependency, and simply removing the linter from the package.json and the gulpfile appears to break deployment in a way I don't currently understand.
